posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I've been mulling over Arcane Archers again, and would welcome your thoughts on this one.

My previous foray into the class was a "Gun 'n Run" AA/ Monk. This one is more of a sniper, picking a position, unloading elven pointy death, vanishing, relocating, unloading elven pointy...you get the idea. You may even hear a spectral song echoing in her wake and announcing her arrival.

Now, the problems (as far as I see them, anyway, you'll likely find others). Two crappy saves (Fort and Will both under 20). Rubbish in melee (not that she should be indulging in such a pedestrian activity), with no Finesse or Focus. Horribly feat-starved pre-epic - and I'd particularly welcome your advice here. I have four feats competing for three places, and all have their merits. Blind Fight. Has always been a must-have in my builds so far, but with elf vision and SD's dark vision, might it be sacrificed? Improved Critical. Does what it says on the tin and hard to ignore. Rapid Shot. More shooting, and the AB can easily handle it, so can't be a bad thing, can it? Called Shot. Slow the beggars down to give a more leisurely approach to dropping them, what could go wrong? Hence my dilemma.

On the plus side: an unbuffed AB of 59 with longbow, and plenty of damage to sit with it. A naked AC of 32, which ain't too shabby. HiPS and Uncanny Dodge (SD is actually taken more for the UD than the HiPS, for once - not that I'm complaining). Ample skill points. Bard Song level 11 for a boost all around.

I've yet to check out other builds of a similar nature, nor have I factored in elf "things" yet. I thought I'd check the concept first.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
There is nothing wrong with the concept here.
I have even made builds with Bard 9/ SD 2/ AA 29.
Orion is right about the high AB. You don't need that much AB for most purposes, except maybe for "impossible" boss fights against an extremely high AC. Enchant Arrow is not only about AB, it is also about damage, and with this kind of build it becomes the most important part of the damage. There is low strength for use with mighty bows, and even with strength items bows with more than mighty 5 may be hard to find. There is no SA, no EWS, no Bane weapon etc. Bard song adds a small bonus to damage and you may use arrows with a damage bonus, but EA is your main source of damage.
SD indeed gives Uncanny dodge and Evasion, but don't underestimate HIPS. When I play this kind of archer, stealth and HIPS become the main means of crowd control. It is indeed a "sniper" build and it is fairly easy to solo.
Now there is an option to take 10 levels of SD (Bard 8/ SD 10/ AA 22) and qualify for Epic dodge. That is a better defensive build, but The EA damage is not as good.
Called shot is not a main strategy with this build, but it can be useful against true seers to slow them down.
You are right about the saves, Fort and Wis are very bad, and there is not much you can do about it build wise. Gear and spells may offer the protection you need.
I found one error in the build-draft: SD can not come before lvl 8 - you need 10 ranks of Hide first.

PS: You struggle with 4 feats you want in 3 pre epic slots. It is possible to aim at dex 36. You can replace a Great dexterity feat with one of the feats you want in. To even off the dexterity, one option is to take Armor skin, another is to start with 1 less dexterity and spend the buy points elsewhere.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Many thanks, both. I'll now go away with some damp towels for my head and try to see if I can come up with something better.

My initial thinking was that with EA not counting towards the +20 AB cap I should push it, thus allowing other types of gear to enhance other areas further without too much worry, but I will take sage counsel on this.

I probably should have mentioned at the outset that - me being me - I was never looking for caster stuff here. And nor, this time, was I wanting any sort of tankiness. If I'm getting hit, I'm not playing the build properly. Hence no Toughness as a consideration - nor indeed Armour Skin. And I even contemplated dropping CON down to 8 and bumping Strength to 14. That said, I did have a look at a Bard 9/ SD 2/ AA 29, and it was a bit too scary for me - you know, just in case, spacing the Tumbles out more reasonably. Oh, and I really don't like taking pre-epic feats in epic levels (and for that I blame most of the great and the good - yes, Mick, Empyre and Valerfor, I'm looking at you).

And apologies for misplacing SD1 - that's just me and some pencil and paper issues - I'll sort it.

Good to know we may have a future here. Right, time for towels and scotch (for creative purposes only, obviously).

Cheers
